title.narrative: SEEV

description.narrative: CSOs, CBOs, community members with specific focus on women

In response to the inequalities faced by conflict-affected women and girls living in Abujubeiha and Rashad localities, South Kordofan, CARE will support the development of inclusive local decision-making structures, engagement of men and boys to combat violence against women and girls, and economic empowerment of women. At a strategic level, CARE will work with traditional community and religious leaders, local line ministries, Civil Society Organisations (CSOs), Community-Based Organisations (CSOs) and individual activists to orient and train them in gender-positive policies and tools; men and boys will specifically be engaged as powerful voices in support of women and to combat traditional notions of masculinity and femininity and associated discriminatory and violent practices. At the grassroots, CARE will provide vocational livelihoods training to women, enabling them to participate in the value chain, supporting economic empowerment and providing psychosocial support; furthermore, through the Village Savings and Loan model, women will gain access to microfinance support. This multifaceted approach will engage the whole community to improve quality of life for everyone, ensuring that nobody is left behind.

name.narrative: شارع الابيض - النهود, Al-Ubayyid, Bara, North Kordofan State, Sudan

title.narrative: Women ,youth and other community members benefiting from mobilization, sensitization and training on leadership ,decision making and representation, mentored and supported
# of youth groups established trained and supported
#of VDCs established or strengthened, trained and supported

comment.narrative: 21 Women have been identified as influencers from 4 communities in Abujebiha locality & 4 communities in Rashad locality. These women are envisoned to attract and motivate a larger group of influencers at their community.

title.narrative: # of women groups established trained and supported
# of female influencers groups established and trained

comment.narrative: An agreement has been finalized with two women empowerment & Gender specialists from Al-Ahfad University for Women to provide training & mentorship activities for women leaders. The training is planned in JAN 2021.

title.narrative: # of sessions conducted by female influencers groups

comment.narrative: it is planned to conduct these sessions shortly after the female influencers received the training with the support of the 2 consultants within the coming reporting period.

title.narrative: # women participating in the decision making spaces

comment.narrative: 150 Women engaged across 10 localities where women groups have been established. The women have been trained leadership and decision making.

title.narrative: Successful women in leadership roles recognized , celebrated and advocacy for female empowerment is ensured
# of visits by male and female parliamentarians to each community

comment.narrative: Not yet conducted as the parliament is not selected yet. This activity will take place as soon as the parliament is set-up - subject to political agreements. However the project is assessing other options which will be feasible within the remainder of the project.

title.narrative: # of ongoing technical and on job mentoring support sessions to women leaders conducted.

comment.narrative: This will be conducted by the specialists from Ahfad University for Women after the women leaders receive the basic training & get back to their communities.

title.narrative: # of successful women in leadership roles sessions conducted

comment.narrative: This is will be conducted in consultation with the experts & women groups in Q1.

title.narrative: Create economic opportunities for diversified livelihood options and increased resilience to shocks and stresses
% Female who reported improved access to earning opportunities and markets

comment.narrative: Based on the anecdotal information, over 1000 women have been supported with viable livelihoods opportunities and enhanced access to markets.

title.narrative: % of women who have increased income
% of individuals who have access to financial services (SADD)

comment.narrative: Effort is underway to establish VSLAs across the 10 targeted communities with the intention of improving women's access to financial services. To date the cumulative savings are over 20,000 Euros which is a good indicator towards enhancing women access to financial services.

title.narrative: % of people who are engaged in profitable income generating activities (SADD)

comment.narrative: Over 2,000 women to date are engaging IGAs including those in VSLAs.

title.narrative: Target community in mango business (production & Processing) particularly women, organized capacitated and benefiting from improved, inclusive and efficient mango value chain
# of feasibility assessment for mango value chain conducted

comment.narrative: Both assessments have been completed and shared with the embassy.

title.narrative: # of women groups engaged into mango pulp processing and trade established, trained and supported

comment.narrative: 30 Women Mango groups have been established , their capacity developed and assisted to rent mango trees . 10 communities received harvesting kits with supervison from CIS and State ministry of production and Economic resources to sell mango for export and local markets . The same groups are being mobilised to prepare for the next season. Additionally another 10 VSLAs have been mobilized to engage in Mangoes processing as the project is considering Commuity based Mangeos processing enterprises

title.narrative: # of mango producers groups/associations established and strengthened

comment.narrative: 10 Mango producer groups have been established and trained on farm management - safe use of pesticides and fertilizers and provided tips on production of mango for export.

title.narrative: # of mango facilities established/supported

comment.narrative: Pending final decision regarding the way forward for establishing the mango pulp facility.

title.narrative: # of meetings between mango farmers and women groups engaged into mango processing conducted

comment.narrative: 10 Completed meetings - 1 per community in 10 communities. This was done prior to the mango season.

title.narrative: # of mango producer (men ,women) received ToT on mango value chain

comment.narrative: 30 individuals (9 F & 21 M) received ToT on basic principles and guidelines on harvesting and handling. Additionally, 44 Persons were reached through a seminar that was conducted ( 30 males and 14 female from project stakeholders), follow up sessions will continue.

title.narrative: Target community benefiting from agribusiness opportunities and agricultural services within integrative, efficient other different 10 cash crops value chains (including Mango)
# of Value chain analysis conducted for the selected cash crops and workshop conducted

comment.narrative: The validation workshop has been conducted with participation of all stakeholders from Line Ministry, Humanitarian Aid Commission, Value chain groups, Village development committes & the project staff. 29 persons (18 M & 11 F) participated.

title.narrative: # of Value chain implemented (including mangos)

comment.narrative: Implementation is completed for 5 value chains crops (Sorghum, Sesame, Ground nuts, Okra, Cowpeas ) in addition to vegetables value chain which will start in winter season. The goats value chain will be linked with the implementation of the livestock production schemes. These are the prioritised VCs based on the study.

title.narrative: # of training conducted on value chain crops (production, productivity, quality )

comment.narrative: 90 members (38 M; 52 F) of the established 64 VC groups have received ToT on Value chain crops harvesting, Storage & Marketing. The trainers also conducted a cascading training for the rest of the group members.

title.narrative: # of women's vegetable production groups established, trained and supported

comment.narrative: Completed, agricultural extension activities on 10 established groups - 1 per community with 250 women participating. The plan is to engage them in VSLAs to save money and be ready for the next season.

title.narrative: # of demonstration farms implemented

comment.narrative: Completed. Agricultural and extension activities on 3 established demo plots. The plan is to continue supporting them and enabling them to continue on their own.

title.narrative: # of farmers field schools organized

comment.narrative: Agricultural and extension activities on the 3 established FFS completed although unfortunately some damage occured on the farms due to livestock. Groups gained good skills & knowledge and the 3 groups will convert to vegetable production for the upcoming season.

title.narrative: Target community particularly women benefiting from Economic and income opportunities, gaining skills necessary to set-up, run, sustain their livelihoods and access to markets .
# of VSLA established and supported (75%) female representation

comment.narrative: A total of 136 VSLA groups are fully established, supported and functional. Mobilization for the 64 is completed and this will bring the total number of groups to 200 VSLAs next reporting period. Monitoring is ongoing from CARE.

title.narrative: # of women accessing loan through their VSLAs

comment.narrative: Over 3,000 women currently saving and borrowing from the savings and accessing loans .

title.narrative: # of women groups organized and liked to MFIs

comment.narrative: 4 groups comprising of 100 women have been linked with the department of social services in SK and will be receiving loans at 0 % interest. 1,000,000 SDG will be accessed by the 4 groups.The Ministry internal process and changes regarding registration policies causes some delays. Additionally, a discussion with Barrha MFI was undertaken and concluded to provide loans for more VSLAs. This will be reflected next reporting period

title.narrative: # of IGAs group established and strengthened

comment.narrative: 12 groups have been identified & established to undertake different IGAs including (2 Oil pressing, 1 Handcrafts, 2 beekeeping, 1 food processing, 4 Animal feed preparation & 2 vegetable gardening).

title.narrative: # of Individual engaged into IGAs supported

comment.narrative: 12 groups have been established. The project is working on procuring the required materials for their different IGAs.

title.narrative: # of Groups engaged into IGAs Supported

comment.narrative: 12 groups have been established. The project is working on procuring the required materials for their different IGAs.

title.narrative: # of community infrastructure and assets estabilshed/supported to facilitate access to markets

comment.narrative: The construction of the market stalls at 2 localities in six locations is completed.

title.narrative: # of community groups supported by match funds

comment.narrative: 30 groups are currently engaged.

title.narrative: Social norms and practices within communities that enable/disable women will be identified and discussed
#Of social norms and practices brief assessment conducted

comment.narrative: Achieved and report shared.

title.narrative: # of discussion sessions for traditional and religious leaders: on gender, social norms conducted

comment.narrative: Shifted to the next reporting period due to issues with consultant & vendor related to market fluctuation

title.narrative: # of people participating on gender and social norms sessions

comment.narrative: Shifted to the next reporting period due to issues with consultant & vendor related to market fluctuation

title.narrative: Knowledge and awareness of different formal and informal structures on women rights and gender equality issues enhanced

comment.narrative: 5 Completed, 1 at state level, 2 at locality level (Abujubeiha and Rashad) and 2 additional internally for the line ministries.

title.narrative: # of individuals participating on Training and discussion on gender equality to government experts

comment.narrative: Shifted to the next reporting period due to issues with consultant vendor related to market fluctuation

comment.narrative: Shifted to the next reporting period due to issues with consultant vendor related to market fluctuation

comment.narrative: Shifted to the next reporting period due to issues with consultant vendor related to market fluctuation

comment.narrative: Shifted to the next reporting period due to issues with consultant vendor related to market fluctuation

comment.narrative: Completed 10 groups established - one per community in 10 communities in total.

title.narrative: # of trainings conducted for men and boys groups leaders on leadership

comment.narrative: Completed

title.narrative: #women and men mixed group dialogues and discussions session conducted

comment.narrative: replanned for the next reporting period

title.narrative: # of dialogue and discussions sessions among boys and girls in schools on GBV and PSEA conducted

comment.narrative: 14 Completed in 10 locations reaching 1000 boys and girls in schools. Currently, schools are closed and it is not possible to gather people together.

title.narrative: Good practices in GBV management, success role model stories shared and different advocacy events are performed and target communities celebrates women.

comment.narrative: Postponed to Q2

comment.narrative: Postponed to Q2

title.narrative: # of celebration and advocacy events to share role model male stories conducted

comment.narrative: Not yet possible, hopefully in the remaining time some events can still take place.

title.narrative: # of International Women's Day at community and locality level celebrated

comment.narrative: Completed 4 : 1 at state level, 1 locality level and 2 at community level.

title.narrative: # of annual bulletin on anti-GBV produced

comment.narrative: Not yet produced. planned for Q2

title.narrative: Women and girls’ human capital and access to decision making is increased, enabling them to uphold their rights and seek social justice
% of female who reported increase in their decision making roles at household level and representation at community level

comment.narrative: Based on field interactions with project participants, local authorities and stakeholders -it is evident that women are beginning to gain confidence to participate in public arenas as well as the courage to uphold their rights and seek social justice. On basis of observation, over 50% of village development leadership are now women which is a positive step towards empowering women.

title.narrative: % of male who have positive perception and attitude towards women and believe they shall enjoy equal rights

comment.narrative: Current field engagement and activities have seen a number of men willing to support and work with women as equal partners. For example naturally mango trees are owned by men in Rashad and Abujubeihah but in the last season men were willing to partner with women groups in mango business which is something that was not common. Also the local leaders have shown positive attitude towards women.

title.narrative: Create an enabling environment for women and girls to exercise their fundamental rights (HH, community, higher level)
% increase in GBV reported cases
% community members and stakeholders who reported increased knowledge and awareness of gender equality issues and protection.
% of female benefiting from program services (Protection services)
